definitions.definition: Effect in achieving a goal or aim; purpose, use (now usually in negative constructions).
definitions.example: I tried fixing it, to no avail.  Labor, without economy, is of little avail.
While holding an avail yesterday, the candidate lashed out at critics.

definitions.definition: Non-binding notice of availability for work.
A readily available stock of oil.
Benefit; value, profit; advantage toward success.
To turn to the advantage of.
definitions.example: I availed myself of the opportunity.
Artifices will not avail the sinner in the day of judgment.

definitions.definition: To be of use or advantage; to answer or serve the purpose; to have strength, force, or efficacy sufficient to accomplish the object.
definitions.example: Medicines will not avail to halt the disease.
